basic.description:
Selections of oralists for an approved moot are made through a competitive selection process held in the fall term each year and administered by the Moot Court Committee or by the Faculty Supervisor assigned to the moot.  Approved moots are listed a http://law.queensu.ca/jd-studies/experiential-learning/moot-court-program/
Law-473AB Competitive Moot-Oralist
Upper-year J.D. or combined J.D. degree program students selected as an oralist for an approved moot team may be enrolled in LAW-473AB Competitive Moot Court (with permission of the administration) for three upper-year credits to be graded on a letter grade basis by the faculty supervisor upon completion of the moot. LAW-473AB must be added immediately upon selection in the fall term and permission for late enrollment must be sought from the Assistant Dean of Students on behalf of the Academic Standing and Policies Committee. 
Three upper-year credit units, fall/winter term
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Competitive Moot Oralist
